trans-unit.source: Enhancements to the console experience
trans-unit.target: Enhancements to the console experience

trans-unit.source: Note: provide a proposed descriptive title and a brief description
trans-unit.target: Note: provide a proposed descriptive title and a brief description

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Console Enhancements
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Console Enhancements

trans-unit.source: The following changes have been made to powershell.exe to improve the console experience:
trans-unit.target: The following changes have been made to powershell.exe to improve the console experience:

trans-unit.source: VT100 support
trans-unit.target: VT100 support

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 added support for [VT100 escape sequences](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/mt638032(v=vs.85).aspx).
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 added support for [VT100 escape sequences](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/mt638032(v=vs.85).aspx).

trans-unit.source: PowerShell will ignore certain VT100 formatting escape sequences when calculating table widths.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell will ignore certain VT100 formatting escape sequences when calculating table widths.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell also added a new api that can be used in formatting code to determine if VT100 is supported.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell also added a new api that can be used in formatting code to determine if VT100 is supported.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Here is a complete [example](https://gist.github.com/lzybkr/dcb973dccd54900b67783c48083c28f7) that can be used to highlight matches from Select-String.
trans-unit.target: Here is a complete [example](https://gist.github.com/lzybkr/dcb973dccd54900b67783c48083c28f7) that can be used to highlight matches from Select-String.

trans-unit.source: Save the example in a file named `MatchInfo.format.ps1xml`, the to use it, in your profile or elsewhere, run `Update-FormatData -Prepend MatchInfo.format.ps1xml`.
trans-unit.target: Save the example in a file named `MatchInfo.format.ps1xml`, the to use it, in your profile or elsewhere, run `Update-FormatData -Prepend MatchInfo.format.ps1xml`.

trans-unit.source: Note that VT100 escape sequences are only supported starting with the Aniversary update to Windows 10, they are not supported on earlier systems.
trans-unit.target: Note that VT100 escape sequences are only supported starting with the Aniversary update to Windows 10, they are not supported on earlier systems.

trans-unit.source: Vi mode support in PSReadline
trans-unit.target: Vi mode support in PSReadline

trans-unit.source: [PSReadline](https://github.com/lzybkr/PSReadLine) adds support for vi mode.
trans-unit.target: [PSReadline](https://github.com/lzybkr/PSReadLine) adds support for vi mode.

trans-unit.source: To use vi mode, run `Set-PSReadline -EditMode vi`.
trans-unit.target: To use vi mode, run `Set-PSReadline -EditMode vi`.

trans-unit.source: Redirected stdin w/ interactive input
trans-unit.target: Redirected stdin w/ interactive input

trans-unit.source: In earlier versions, starting PowerShell with `powershell -File -` was required when stdin was redirected and you wanted to enter commands interactively.
trans-unit.target: In earlier versions, starting PowerShell with `powershell -File -` was required when stdin was redirected and you wanted to enter commands interactively.

trans-unit.source: With WMF 5.1, this hard to discover option is no longer necessary, you can start powershell without any options, e.g. `powershell`.
trans-unit.target: With WMF 5.1, this hard to discover option is no longer necessary, you can start powershell without any options, e.g. `powershell`.

trans-unit.source: Note that PSReadline does not currently supported redirected stdin, and the builtin commanding line editing experience with redirected stdin is extremely limited, e.g. arrow keys don't work.
trans-unit.target: Note that PSReadline does not currently supported redirected stdin, and the builtin commanding line editing experience with redirected stdin is extremely limited, e.g. arrow keys don't work.

trans-unit.source: A future release of PSReadline should address this issue.
trans-unit.target: A future release of PSReadline should address this issue.
